The Leonard E Parker

Center for Gravitation, Cosmology & Astrophysics

at the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee

Einstein's theory of gravity holds - even in extreme conditions

Work published today has put Einstein's theory of General Relativity to another strict test, and found that it passed with flying colors

Learn More

Radio emission from GW170817 fading

CGCA Prof. David Kaplan has written an article for The Conversation with colleague Prof. Tara Murphy discussing the 6+ months of radio observations of the neutron star merger

Learn More

CGCA in UWM Research Magazine

The Nobel-prize winning discovery of gravitational waves and the subsequent discovery of multi-messenger emission from colliding neutron stars are featured

Learn More

Prof. Dawn Erb Named Kavli Frontiers of Science Fellow

UWM Physics professor Dawn Erb was named a Kavli Frontiers of Science Fellow by the National Academy of Sciences

Learn More

GW150914 - First results from Advanced LIGO

The first significant gravitational wave signal is due to the merger of two black holes

The Leonard E Parker Center for Gravitation, Cosmology and Astrophysics is supported by NASA, the National Science Foundation, the UW-Milwaukee College of Letters and Science, and the UW-Milwaukee Graduate School.
